alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; Upper Jefferson (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 12:25AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN ST. BERNARD, SOUTHEASTERN ST. CHARLES, SOUTHWESTERN ORLEANS, NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN PLAQUEMINES PARISHES THROUGH 100 AM CST... At 1224 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Westwego to near Estelle to 6 miles west of Barataria. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chalmette, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Avondale, Gretna, Westwego, Jean Lafitte, Woodmere, Violet, Terrytown, Meraux, Poydras, Estelle, Arabi, Barataria, and Lafitte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.
